Sure, here is a sample cover letter for the job requirement you provided:

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my interest in the position of cold calling and appointment setting for your commercial cleaning service. With over 7 years of experience in call centers, I have a proven track record of success in generating leads and closing deals via phone. My ability to understand customer needs and tailor my pitch accordingly has resulted in a high conversion rate and substantial sales figures.

I am confident that I can help your company achieve its sales goals and bring in new business. I am excited to work with your provided script and I am able to adapt to the provided training to deliver results. I am a quick learner, efficient in internet research, and can easily adapt to new technologies and platforms. My strong communication skills, persistence, and enthusiasm allows me to overcome objections and build trust with potential clients.

I am committed to providing good quality work, meeting deadlines, and maintaining frequent communication with clients to ensure the smooth progress of the project. I am excited about the opportunity to work with your company and help you achieve your commercial cleaning goals by leveraging my skills and experience.

Thank you for considering my application. I am available for 30 hours a week and looking forward to the opportunity to discuss how I can contribute to your team.

Please find my Voice demo as an attachment.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

This cover letter highlights your relevant experience and skills, and the most important and relevant information for the job, such as the experience you have in call centers, your ability to understand customer needs, and your skills in communication, research and adaptability. It also gives an idea of your availability and your eagerness to work with the company. Additionally, it includes a sentence to remind the hiring manager to listen to your voice demo that is attached to your application.
